intro: Pithecellobium forbesii, commonly known as the Hawaiian pithecellobium, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It produces small, yellow flowers and is often found in dry, sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
